hints.title: Exponential Convergence from LSI
hints.content:
4154: :label: thm-exp-convergence-hybrid
4155: 
4156: If a discrete-time Markov chain satisfies a Log-Sobolev inequality with constant $C_{\text{LSI}}$, then:
4157: 
4158: $$
4159: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \pi) \leq e^{-t/C_{\text{LSI}}} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_0 \| \pi) + C_{\text{asymptotic}}
4160: $$
4161: 
4162: where:
4163: $$
4164: C_{\text{asymptotic}} := \frac{C_{\text{total}}}{\tau(\alpha_{\text{kin}} + \beta_{\text{clone}})}
4165: $$
4166: 
4167: **Proof**: This is the standard Bakry-Émery argument. Iterating the contraction inequality from Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-composition-reference`:
4168: 
4169: $$
4170: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_{t+1} \| \pi) \leq (1 - \epsilon) D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \pi) + C_{\text{total}}
4171: $$
4172: 
4173: gives the geometric series:
4174: $$
4175: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \pi) \leq (1 - \epsilon)^t D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_0 \| \pi) + C_{\text{total}} \sum_{k=0}^{t-1} (1 - \epsilon)^k
4176: $$
